text: Iuka is a city in Pratt County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 151 people lived there. ==History== Iuka was created in 1877. It was named after the Battle of Iuka in Iuka, Mississippi. Iuka was once the county seat. The first post office in Iuka was created in December 1877. ==Geography== Iuka is at (37.729006, -98.732717). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 151 people, 64 households, and 47 families living in Iuka. Of the households, 73.4% owned their home and 26.6% rented their home. The median age was 48.8 years. Of the people, 94.0% were White and 6.0% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 4.6% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 163 people, 79 households, and 49 families living in Iuka. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Iuka - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 382, local school district ;Maps * Iuka City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Pratt County, Kansas Category:1877 establishments in Kansas
title: Iuka, Kansas
